subject: Physics
title: Escape Velocity and Orbital Dynamics
description: Understand how rockets achieve orbit and escape Earth’s gravity.

content.text: To enter orbit or escape a planet, a rocket must reach specific velocities related to gravity and radius.

content.heading: Your Turn
problems: If planet mass doubles, escape velocity changes by factor?
If radius doubles, escape velocity changes by factor?
If G=6.67e-11, M=5.97e24, R=6.37e6, find v_escape (m/s).
If Earth’s escape velocity = 11.2 km/s, convert to m/s.
If escape velocity = sqrt(2GM/R) and G, M constant, what happens when R halves (factor)?
If Mars escape velocity = 5.0 km/s, what is that in m/s?
If Moon escape velocity = 2.4 km/s, m/s?
If Jupiter escape velocity = 59.5 km/s, m/s?
